home.title: Mapping Regions in the City from Citizens´ Perceptions
home.subtitle: CityMe (2022 - 2023)

about.title: CityMe
about.subtitle: Mapping Regions in the City from Citizens´ Perceptions

content.description: The CityMe project aims at creating a framework for mapping, exploring and analyzing official and non-official neighborhoods, regions of interest, districts and other areas that constitute people’s mental map of the city. By harvesting data from our map-based application and social media platforms, we can better understand how citizens spatially reason about administrative and non-administrative regions in the urban landscape, such as parishes, residential areas, informal neighborhoods, historical centers and commercial areas.

Through applying state-of-the-art spatial analysis, our framework can be applied to other cities in order to improve and enhance participatory urban planning, citizen-engagement in public policies and projects in smart cities. CityMe is not only restricted to characterizing different types of regions in the city, but it is also committed to contributing to the efforts of making cities more human through citizen-centered, transparent and bottom-up approaches in various applications in the context of urban intelligence.

Official or non-official regions, areas of interest or vernacular neighborhoods have one thing in common: they are represented by perceptions and cognitive abstractions that residents have of the spatial settings of their cities. Instead of relying on absolute geometric properties, citizens describe and think about different regions of the city through thematic, semantic, and context-specific spatial information. We will use the city of Lisbon (Portugal) as our case study, yet the project will guarantee reproducibility for other cities around the world.

bullets: make available a web map survey and questionnaire interface
perform spatial analysis to compare and characterize the regions from surveyed data and user-generated content from social media
evaluate survey results based on sociodemographic attributes
explore results based on administrative boundaries, official names, census blocks, urban morphology, landmarks and points of interest

content.topLine: One of the most importante steps in our project is your contribution!
content.description: If you currently live in Lisbon or have lived in the city before, participate in our survey! By drawing your opinion about where certain regions and neighborhoods are located, you will help us to map and better understand the city accoding to the citizens.

content.topLine: FCT is the Portuguese national funding agency for science, research and technology
content.description: Ministry for Science, Technology and Higher Education.
You will find here the research outputs of our project. Data, articles, conference participations and other dissemination products will be available to the public.
For questions or suggestions, issues related to the website and the survey as well as more information about the project, please contact:

home.Subtitle: Hello!
home.MainText:
The following map survey is aimed at collecting data for the CityMe research project (EXPL/GES-URB/1429/2021), funded by the Portuguese Foundation for Science and Technology (FCT). Your contribution is extremely important for our research!

The questionnaire and map-based survey should take less than 15 minutes altogether, although the required time may vary depending on your answers.

We recommend that you take the survey on a laptop or desktop computer, as ease of use and performance should be higher than on smartphones and other mobile devices.

home.Subtitle: Data
home.MainText: Data collected from this survey will be treated as confidential and anonymous, without any personal identification. Your e-mail is required below because participants should not be able to take the survey twice. As the collected data is for research activities only, it will not be used or shared for commercial purposes or distributed to third parties. For more information regarding the project, you can check our website or contact one of our team members.

exit.msubmission: The survey is incomplete, please answer all questions
exit.mcode: If you want to come back later, use your code
exit.mwarning: *If you lose this code you will not be able to finish the survey

checkbox.agreement: I have read and agree with the data use terms.
checkbox.shared_info: I agree to participate in this survey.

polygon.end: Click on the first point to close this shape.

rectangle.start: Click and drag to draw a rectangle.

edit.text: Drag handles or marker to edit features.

remove.text: Click on a feature to remove.

simpleshape.end: Release the mouse button to finish drawing.

geometryinput.inputtext: You can also add additional information in the form of tags. If you remember any places, streets or landmarks that, in your opinion, represent or define this area, let us know! You can click on your shape and add your tags by typing, pressing enter and click save.

submit.title: Thank you!
submit.midtext: Your contribution is extremely valuable for our research!
submit.endtext: If you wish to contact us or know more about the project, please check our website
